DataElement.preferredName: Patient Wound Complication Personal Medical History Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures who has complications to wounds (healing complications) in their personal history.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Wound Complication Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures who has complications to wounds (healing complications) in their personal history.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a serio
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious non-healing wound, ulcer or bone fracture?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of poor wound healing, non-healing ulcers or bone fractures within the last three months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious non-healing wound (including gastrointestinal), ulcer or bone fracture

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any surgical or other wounds that have not adequately healed

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious non-healing wound, ulcer or bone fracture within 28 days of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a serious non-healing wound, ulcer or bone fracture within 28 days of starting study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of serious or non-healing wound, ulcer, or bone fracture?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a non-healing wound or compound bone fracture

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a non-healing wound, unhealed or incompletely healed fracture,  or compound bone fracture

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a non-healing wound, ulcer, or bone fracture?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious, non-healing or dehiscing wound, active ulcer or untreated bone fracture

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious or non-healing wound, ulcer or bone fracture or history of abdominal fistula, intra-abdominal abscess requiring major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to registration, with the exception of craniotomy for cranial resection?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious or non-healing wound, ulcer or bone fracture or history of abdominal fistula, intra-abdominal abscess requiring major surgical procedure, open biopsy or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to step 2 registration, with the exception of craniotomy for cranial resection.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a serious or non-healing wound or ulcer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of intra-abdominal abscess within 3 months prior to the anticipated start date of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of serious or non-healing wound or bone fracture (pathologic fracture of primary tumor is not considered exclusion)?

DataElement.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-3b 2958018v1 with VD ID#3506036 - Yes No Not Applicable Indicator - dbw
